```{r setup}
library(courtr)
```

Characters can be viewed and edited through the [Edit_Figures()] function.
This function will open an RShiny app that allows for the customization of characters.
The available character outfits are shown below.

```{r study-outfits, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, out.width = "24%", fig.cap = "Available outfits: analyst, defendant, hazmat, inmate, judge, lawyer, police, and scientist", fig.show="hold"}

knitr::include_graphics(system.file("figures", "analyst.svg", package="courtr", mustWork=TRUE))
knitr::include_graphics(system.file("figures", "defendant.svg", package="courtr", mustWork=TRUE))
knitr::include_graphics(system.file("figures", "hazmat.svg", package="courtr", mustWork=TRUE))
knitr::include_graphics(system.file("figures", "inmate.svg", package="courtr", mustWork=TRUE))
knitr::include_graphics(system.file("figures", "judge.svg", package="courtr", mustWork=TRUE))
knitr::include_graphics(system.file("figures", "lawyer.svg", package="courtr", mustWork=TRUE))
knitr::include_graphics(system.file("figures", "police.svg", package="courtr", mustWork=TRUE))
knitr::include_graphics(system.file("figures", "scientist.svg", package="courtr", mustWork=TRUE))

```
